WRITING.TITLE: #ProudToBe is one big miss representation
WRITING.TEXT:
Alright, I've got too much bottled up hate, I never really had this problem before but this is too much. First a little bit of background about who I am. Skip to the next half of the thread if you wanna get to the point right now.
I'm Bisexual, but I've never had a problem with it. I grew in a low income family and went to medium class over the years so I could afford all levels of education; currently in College.
That means I've met a bunch of people like most of you do, I wasn't secluded on some mountain. I always liked girls since I was 5 years old but only at 13 I had attraction for a male friend for the first time.
But at that age we made jokes about gays so it wasn't obviously going anywhere, and I didn't actually care that much since I also liked some girls. I'm not talking about love, it's just that I was like "hmm, he/she's pretty"
And that's it. Since then I can totally see some dude and think he's hot, I would bang him, but just like you don't fall in love with everyone, I've only ended up dating some girls by chance. Not many mind you, I'm your average redditor who is mostly on the internet or playing videogames. Sexual orientation doesn't really do much. I've told some close friends on college but only as a novelty, I said I was more into girls and didn't really like them, we laughed about it and we never talked about it again.
What do you get from this story? I am Bisexual, but it doesn't define who I am. Sexuality shouldn't be your identity. I still have a functioning brain and my actions aren't decided by my "sexual identity".
Of course, it'd be for the better if I could freely talk with everyone about being Bisexual without raising any brows. I'm a pretty normal person, I use the F-word and some slurs and don't get offended by "anti-LGBT" trolls because I KNOW I am normal.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
And that's where the problem starts. I'm all for Lesbians, Gays and Bisexuals acceptance. They are mostly accepted by the society right now, we're constantly showing that WHICH PEOPLE YOU DECIDE TO LOVE DOESN'T CHANGE WHO YOU ARE.
Getting my point by now? We're gaining the RIGHT to be part of the mainstream culture. Well, I already consider myself part of it, advantages of being Bi, but there are people out there who still feel oppressed.
Since the Orlando shooting happened, it was the best time to show the world that homosexuals and bisexuals are the same as you and I. We're no different. For all you know, Superman might be banging Batman while we don't watch, because sexuality has nothing to do with who we are. It's about loving someone.
With the years we're always represented as sexual, flamboyant deviants who are only sex driven or have weird mannerisms but that was wearing down with time. Here it is, Youtube will release a video, it will surely be a big hit and open some eyes.
And man, it DID open some eyes. Wide. In shock. I never cared that much about being Bi but I was happy that everything was going places, then I watch the video and see how they lumped us together with... I don't even think transexuals is the right word. Some kind of queers I believe talking about omnisexuality, being agender, some thing which didn't even said what it was and looked like an alien (probably by choice, that's the bad part) and some other gross stuff.
By now you're probably outraged but so am I, that was the last straw. I was always like "homosexuals are fine, they could be a part of society and you wouldn't know because it doesn't mean they become monsters or something, they don't stick out"
AND YOUTUBE JUST TURNS 180 DEGREES! To drag down the whole community and tell people "look at this rogues gallery, lovable aren't they?" as if they were fucking mocking us.
No, please, no. People thinking homosexuals are flamboyants was a bad enough stereotype, not even I like them so I get why someone would get grossed out by them. BUT YOUTUBE GOES AND SHOWS SOMETHING TOTALLY DIFFERENT
That's not a right message, people already had a hard time with homosexuality and instead of saying "Your sexual orientation doesn't make you weird" they just go and show people with sexualities no normal people has ever heard of AND people who totally mutated their bodies.
Be assured we LGB aren't anything like that. It was the last straw. Now I fully believe that instead of adding more letters to "LGB", they should just separate and form a whole new acronym with the rest of Queers. We were close to being mainstream and that sent us directly to the abyss so hard Youtube had to deactivate comments.
It doesn't matter if Trans were once avid fighters for our rights, thing is, LGB is practially mainstream and they are dragging us down HARD.
Right now, Trans on the LGB is the same as People of Colour on the LGB. Sure, both want to fight for their rights, but they are different battles.
LGB is about being normal even tho you have a different taste for your partners, T is not a sexual orientation at all. They are asking a totally different kind of acceptance; a physical one with an image who doesn't fit the standards of society.
Now a lot of people and me just feel like we'll need to wait some more years to freely talk about who we like because Youtube grossed out the public showing people and putting us ALL under the same banner, "LGBT", while it's inaccurate. For god's sake, on that video were things that would scare children, that's not a good image to have you know!?!?
We're not partners on the same community anymore. 3 letters are fighting to be accepted for who they love and be able to lead an average life, while you fight for your "identity" and it gets really blurry what falls under that definition.

That's the problem, gay lesbians and bisexuals aren't queer.
Let them have their own movement.
